newsitem.title: UK: UK's FTSE opens 2.5 pct lower after Wall St plunge.
newsitem.headline: UK's FTSE opens 2.5 pct lower after Wall St plunge.

text.p: The FTSE 100 index of blue-chip UK shares plunged 2.5 percent at the start of trade on Tuesday as heavy losses on Wall Street sent tremors through European equity markets and raised fears that the bull run was over.
"Is the big correction people have been warning about finally here? This could certainly be the start of it. The mood is very nervous," one dealer said.
The FTSE 100 opened 107.8 points lower at 4,205.1, and struggled slightly higher to 4,211.6 by 0754 GMT, down 101.3 points from Thursday's pre-Easter close.
Since London closed on Thursday the Dow has dived 250 points, hit by higher bond yields and earnings concerns.
